Articles.Content:
I am quite pleased to announce that the Duna expedition I posted about recently was a complete success, and I even managed to squeeze in a landing for a final "Why-the-heck-not" moment that turned into one of my greatest triumphs!

Here's the mission album: http://imgur.com/a/zHGCY#6

And here's the album all about the Daedalus Mk V launch system: http://imgur.com/a/qXhmo#0

With this landing, I usher my space program further than ever before, and will keep doing so for SCIENCE!

Thank you all!
Congrats on your 1st interplanetary trip. Now, can you get home?
Nice one! It's a heck of a thrill landing on a new body for the first time, isn't it? Any ideas for a follow-on mission?
Oh no, probably not until two missions later, when I can mine some Kethane. That lander you see is a one-stop deal, unfortunately. But it'll do for a first!
